column1: Vari (Greek: Βάρη) is a southern suburb of Athens and former municipality in East Attica
column2: Greece. Since the 2011 local government reform it is part of the municipality Vari-Voula-Vouliagmeni
column3: of which it is a municipal unit. The municipal unit has an area of 22.633 km2.

column1: It lies at the southwestern end of the Mesogeia plain and the southeast shoulder of the Hymettus mountain
column2: near the Saronic Gulf coast. Greek National Road 91 connects Vari with Athens city centre and Sounio. Vari's beach is located in an area called Varkiza
column3: a fishing village that joined the municipality of Vari
column4: in 1997. This particular beach has won the blue flag many years in the past

column1: After 1 January 2011 Vari joined Voula and Vouliagmeni
